intro: Capanemia pygmaea, commonly known as the dwarf capanemia, is a small flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
